summary_sents: WASHINGTON , October 17 ( Xinhua ) -- The crime rate in the United States declined in 1998 for the seventh straight year , with the murder and robbery rates being the lowest in three decades , the Federal Bureau of Investigation ( FBI ) reported Sunday .
The nation 's big cities experienced the steepest decline in their crime rate , with a 5 percent drop , while suburban counties saw a decrease of 4 percent , and rural areas were down 1 percent .

But in building a penal system in which three of every 10 new prisoners are serving time for drugs , according to the Pennsylvania Sentencing Commission , which tracks prison rates for the state , Pennsylvania , like most states , has not reduced illegal drug use .
Crime rates involving property , including burglary and motor vehicle theft , dropped 9 percent from 1998 to 1999 , decreasing from 217 per 1,000 U.S. households to 198 per 1,000 households .

During this period , the rate of violent crimes in general declined 32.7 percent , while robbery with injury dropped 38.5 percent , aggravated assault decreased 41.2 percent and rape fell 40 percent .

DETROIT ( AP ) -- The city 's murder rate , already among the highest in the nation , jumped 16.7 percent in the first half of 1999 -- baffling city leaders who have watched a decline in the number of other serious crimes .

NEW ORLEANS ( AP ) -- A week after Mayor Marc Morial received a national award for overhauling the city police department and a coinciding drop in crime , two teen-agers were murdered after leaving a weekend party in an upscale neighborhood .
Selected checks of major cities , including Baltimore , Boston , Dallas , Los Angeles , New York and Philadelphia , found that murders are up over last year .
Americans were more secure in their homes from 1998 to 1999 , with the number of completed burglaries dropping from 38.5 per 1,000 households to 34.1 per 1,000 , an 11.4 percent fall .
